website_summaries.verdict: A THX-certified 2.1 speaker system that brings your music, movies, and games to life like never before.
pros: Includes a ported, down-firing subwoofer that delivers deep, rich bass
Offers RCA and 3.5mm inputs that make it easy to plug in up to three audio devices at the same time
Boasts 400 watts of peak power to provide studio-quality audio
cons: Sometimes cut off in the middle of use

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, appalling quality control.
customer_reviews.text: I have received two defective units in a row. The first one had a nonfunctional headphone jack. The second one had a volume knob that was mounted far off center and would not turn, and a loud buzzing noise coming from the sub. The sound quality of the speakers themselves is great, so I will try one more time. If the third unit is also defective, I'm swearing off Logitech speakers and telling everyone I know to do the same. EDIT: The third unit was also defective. Disgraceful. It's a damn shame, because I loved the way they sound. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Debora W

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy! Edited review after one month.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased because people claimed it was amazing but when I listen to it, it sound alright. at loud levels the speakers cant keep up and the bass pops so you need to keep it turned down. I have klipsich spekers that were $20 more and sound better. Disapointed in the bass quality and wish the speakers were not $150 more like $90 in my opinion. EDIT: After a month of use the bass has blown and now the speakers just sound afwul. Very disappointed in these speakers and wish I had never bought them. Do yourself a favor and do not buy. 3 star review lowered to a 1 star....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: Sound great until it started going intermittent. The connection to the satellite speaker was not tight enough and it would cut out anytime the cord got moved a little. Always had to push it back in to get the left speaker to stay on. Then after a year and a half the woofer suddenly stopped working altogether. It was used in a shared office and it never got cranked up excessively. Just normal use. Played music daily. I enjoyed it while it lasted. Get the extended warranty. I would buy it again with the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Specbolt

customer_reviews.title: NOT for home computer
customer_reviews.text: I advise that you review all available video reviews of this speaker system if you intend to plug this into your computer. Major drawbacks: - the cable for the right speaker is a very short ~4.5' to 5' in length. - if the right speaker is the one that's furthest from the bass unit, then you're out of luck. - the right speaker plug is some proprietary connector, so extending that cord will be a very frustrating & possibly costly experience. - the cabling is extremely thick and difficult to hide and negotiate in tight locations - the speakers are very large and bulky, your desktop area & patience will never forgive you
customer_reviews.author: Pat Gregory

customer_reviews.title: BLAST your house with sound!
customer_reviews.text: You see a lot of reviews where people take the audio scene a bit too seriously, calling themselves audiophiles, and basically insulting anyone who uses products like Logitech for audio. IGNORE THEM. These speakers will BLAST your house with excellent clarity and rich, deep bass. I use it for my gaming PC, and music for the entire house when partying, cleaning, cooking, etc. The bass knob on the front right speaker makes it for easy adjustments. I usually keep it at 50% bass because it will shake pictures off my walls if I go too high.
customer_reviews.author: Tim R.

customer_reviews.title: Before the subwoofer went they were excellent speaker system for the computer
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1/13/17 subwoofer stopped working in September of 2017. Before the subwoofer went they were excellent speaker system for the computer. Without the subwoofer all you have is 2 okay speakers. I expect any product from Logitech to last over 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Pantera

customer_reviews.title: O.M.G.  Just get it!
customer_reviews.text: O.M.G. These sound amazing! Deep booming base, with no distortion to the mid and high range frequencies. I read all the raving reviews, plus the negative reviews. I believe the some people must have received defective units. I don't have that high pitched sound coming from one speaker, or anything else to complain about. These are the best computer speakers I've ever owned - by far. I'm just using the audio from my motherboard (). I running Windows 10. BTW, for speaker setup, Windows 10 provides some "full-range speakers" option. Make sure that is checked. You don't want Windows filtering out low end frequencies - this speaker system has the appropriate cross-over to send base to the sub-woofer.
customer_reviews.author: critical_g

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't get all the positive reviews, even found one that states he worked at his dad's recording studio, and then goes on to compare them to $6,000 speakers. I bought a $25 set of 2.1 computer speakers at Walmart 20 years ago that are still going strong that have twice the sound quality as these speakers do. I wanted another 2.1 set for my new system, mainly for gaming. I finally decided on Edifier S350DB. Beautiful sound quality for a set this small. Most of the reviewers for these speakers obviously just don't know what quality speaker sounds like.
customer_reviews.author: Brian12345

customer_reviews.title: $99 is a steal! Crispy, loud, deep ported bass! 10/10 recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I already own a set of Logitech z323 speakers do I had high expectations for these z623! To say the LEAST, these speakers BLEW me & my dad away! The tweeters are crisp, clear, and at max volume there is no distortion! As for the subwoofer, even better! Deep & low thumps that’ll rock your walls, literally! Also, no distortion at max volume! Build great, looks great, it’s flawless. Only thing I wish these had was Bluetooth, I’d pay $150 for these easily if it came with Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Young

customer_reviews.title: Like a movie theater
customer_reviews.text: My wife hates these speakers because they make the TV sound "like a movie theater." I thought that was pretty funny then my daughter ramped it up too fast and blasted out our eardrums. The clarity and neutral frequency response is amazing. It sounds like the actors are in your living room. Simple controls and wiring. But decided to keep the family and send the speakers back. This kind of overpowered product is why we can't have nice things.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cornett

customer_reviews.title: amazing sound and ease of operation
customer_reviews.text: I had a good system that I purchased at amazon. It just didn't have the power I wanted....good sound but not enough. We researched and decided on the Z623 system. Ooooh.....so much better !! The quality of the sound is amazing and the bass (ajustable) is awesome. This little system is just perfect for the $. There is more powerful systems out there....but watts/dollar....you can't beat this system. If you love quality sound....with good highs....mids....and bass.....this is it. Also, Amazon....you folks are wonderful. Thanks for so many times being the source of providing us the products ( shoes....clothes...home appliances.....jewerly.....sooooo many items ) Thank You !
customer_reviews.author: Jim & Diane pulley

customer_reviews.title: What Warranty?
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for seven months then quit. One has to dissect website to find proper links to file claim then when one is filed no answer, no response. Out right fraud.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: affordable and plenty of punch and power.
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this on 5-31-18 its now 12-7-18 i dont do reviews out of the box just to be happy with a purchase. i listen to rap/rock/heavy metal right back down to dubstep. for less then 150$ this thing pounds. i have it facing a corner under my desk and i can rattle the change off my desk. i didnt buy this for surround gaming or anything like that i bought this strictly for music. it slays. buy one. video doesnt do it justice. if your an apartment dweller .. this will definately piss your neighbors off. music is andy james for those interested.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these to replace her 2.nosub Bose speakers. While the Bose sounded good considering there is no sub, these BLEW them away. I had a 5.1 Logitech system (more expensive) and mine barely beat these in sound quality, but they also got hot after listening at a loud volume for extended periods of time. This system doesn't have the problem. She has had them for about a year now and still kicking. I would recommend these speakers to anyone, especially for the price. I actually replaced my 5.1 system for these as I really don't have a need for 5.1 sound in the computer room and I do like it LOUD :)
customer_reviews.author: James Gharis

customer_reviews.title: If you like alot of base/boom, these are for you.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace another brand I've had for years that had developed a short. These don't sound as good as my old ones. They lack the "highs" my old speakers had. It's alot of base, which, to me, makes them sound kind of muffled because the treble isn't there. I have these paired with a pair of small Bose, which makes up for the lack of highs. If I didn't have the Bose & just had to listen to these alone, I'd return them. But, they are high quality and maybe other people aren't as picky as I am about their sound systems. If you like floor shaking base/boom sound, these would be what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: M Cruv

customer_reviews.title: amazing speaker! slight buzz 5 months later
customer_reviews.text: didn't realize how much of an audiophile i was until i got these truly amazing they look a little simple and basic but they will blow you away 5 Months later update: i've started to notice a buzz anytime there's no audio being played and eventually stops sounds like some king of electrical issue you do end up toning it out plus i'm only a foot away from them on my desk thus the 4 stars (and i do turn them off anytime i'm not using them) overall still the best set of speakers i've ever owned nothing matches this sound quality
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Way beyond high expectations
customer_reviews.text: Got these today and set them up in my bedroom. The cables are each 6 feet and my speakers are 10 feet apart on bookshelves. Woofer is on the floor in the middle. I'm 11 feet from the mid range speakers. Sound is perfect, exceeds expectations. Very precise and realistic. I'm one happy camper. I have the older Logitech 2300 with my computer but with everything so close the effect is just like you know with computer speakers, very good but not exceptional. I'm bowled over, and for $100!!!! PS: I'm using my iPhone 7plus and iTunes with a long cable but tomorrow will go Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Culture Man

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are better than the Cyber Acoustic speakers, which I threw away. But I had to remove the metal grills over the tweeters to avoid distortion at the higher frequencies--speech was almost unintelligible. Removing the grills was no easy task, and I had to watch 3 YouTube videos before I found all the well-hidden screws securing the speaker cases. My next project will be to remover the metal grill over the woofer to avoid distortion at low frequencies. I can understand that manufacturers want to protect speakers from physical damage, but the price users pay in sound quality in unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Crackling/Popping Noise ruins experience
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these May 11, 2018 I got analog because my computer doesn't have optical output. These are great sound speakers except one crucial problem They developed crackling/popping noise. I tried to trouble shoot and if you plug in audio cable into aux input ( located on small right speaker, one with volume and bass control) instead of bass input and crackling/popping disappears. This doesn't solve the problem since running speakers that way creates annoying hum (think of a guitar amp hum without noise gate) even if sound is set to 0 on a computer. Do I still have warranty to get this fixed? Anybody knows what causes it?
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail

customer_reviews.title: After 4 years of owning, thought it's time to give a review!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these about 4 years ago. I have used these for my gaming PC which also serves as our Media center (music, movies, etc.) These speakers and the sub are AMAZING. After 4 years, still sound as great as the day I bought them. Super loud, crisp, and clear! Sub is amazing and deep! Seriously best bang for buck I've spent on audio system. Can't believe the sound and volume that comes out of this small system. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DaftPunked

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but huge.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is very nice and comparable to my 15 year old JBL speakers that died to make room for these. I apparently should have read more closely about their size though... They are comparatively huge. The desk units could be halved in size, and the subwoofer box is huge compared to the size of the driver. Oh well, I've gotten used to them. Optical audio in is nice plus. My old speakers picked up a 60Hz buzz if I wasn't careful about routing the cords.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lembcke

customer_reviews.title: Alexa likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Very quickly, I bought this to enhance the puny speakers on my echo plus. Once I figured out where the cables go, it took just another minute to hear echo-originated audio to pour out of this system. Bass is mighty, and there is one knob to turn for more or less of it. I wish there was a similar knob for treble. Note: you must have a 3.5mm male-to-male stereo audio cable in the right length for the connection. I am happy with Mediabridge, which is nicely priced. We now have 3 echo devices hooked up to external systems and/or speakers.
customer_reviews.author: LarryAt27N

customer_reviews.title: Best Available in Price Range
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered these, I already had one just like it. Initially, I ordered the Klipsch ProMedia 2.1 because many reviewers say they were better for music. When I plugged in the ProMedia speakers, I immediately could hear a hum coming from the subwoofer. An internet search showed that I was not alone. Music did sound fuller and crisper through the ProMedias, but that hum could not be ignored. So, I sent them back and ordered another set of these Logitech Z623. The Logitech may not reproduce the mid-range as well as the ProMedia, but the Logitech subwoofer does NOT hum. It's too bad. Klipsch used to be a good brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Tickle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Logitech speakers are of the highest quality. I have purchased Logitech speakers for years and they are always quality speakers. The Logitech Z623 400 Watt Home Speaker System is the best to date. Incredible sound comes out of this system. I have it connected to my Samsung Smart LED TV and the sound quality is second to none. I am going to buy another set for my other Samsung TV. Don't hesitate to buy this system, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Z

customer_reviews.title: A lot better sound for the price than I had expected.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a unit for my desk and set it up. I was AMAZED at the quality of the sound and the fullness of the base. I plugged the system into the headphone jack on my Apple Mini and didn't use a digital connection (extra cost). That didn't seem to matter. I immediately purchased another set for my wife's desk. Great Bang for the Buck!! I subscribed to Amazon Music Unlimited. As I write this, there are castanets playing and I looked around the room to make sure the sound was actually coming from the Logitech System.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality for gaming / music
customer_reviews.text: So I work on the phone during the week. When I get home I like to game. I have a great headset but working on the phone for 8 hours a day makes me not want to wear it. Looking for a good sound option I stumbled on these. Absolutely Love them so far and its been about 2 weeks. Day 1-3 I listened to music for 4-5 hours straight each day because it just sounded so great. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: This set is amazing. I have this hooked up to a tv ...
customer_reviews.text: This set is amazing. I have this hooked up to a tv and a computer. Not only does it blow away any speaker set I have ever owned it actually sounds like a high end car stereo. The sub will beat down. Probably shouldn't get this if you live in an apartment or duplex. It will piss off the neighbors. I love logitech speaker products. I have a logitech x-530 5.1 system I bought 13 years ago and I use it for a tv and it still works great. another great way to use this is to pair it with a logitech bluetooth adapter which is also a great product.
customer_reviews.author: optimal

customer_reviews.title: Works well (after I replaced a cable)
customer_reviews.text: After I set it up, the left speaker wouldn't work. A few times I'd get some sound from it, but most of the time it would go silent. I decided to buy this from Amazon: "Mediabridge 3.5mm Male To Male Stereo Audio Cable (8 Feet) - Step Down Design for iPhone, iPod, Smartphone, Tablet and MP3 Cases." Problem solved! Logitech should have provided a better male to male audio cable, but as it stands the speakers work. The volume can be set quite loud (I haven't turned them up all the way). Sound quality is adequate to good. For this price point, you get a pretty decent system.
customer_reviews.author: Jose J. Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Great computer speakers
customer_reviews.text: Overall these sound great with the sub providing a nice full sound. Have no complaints about sound quality. Pretty much perfect PC speakers so far. Can produce more volume than is necessary unless you're hosting a dance party in a very large room. I haven't been able to make them distort at full volume. Hoping they will last for many years. My 1 complaint is the RCA cable that connects the left speaker to the sub doesn't press in very tightly. Likely could squeeze the ends with pliers to make it fit more snug, but don't plan on moving the sub around much and hasn't caused any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers a bit lacking in the high end
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I got the model with the optical hook up and I really like the the sound for general computer video watching. It's not the best choice for music listening. I heard a Klipsch Pro Media that was much better for music, but was much weaker for video. The Z625 does pretty well and won't bother my landlord as much as the 900 series 5+1 that I really wanted. Sound quality is good for the price and I'm very happy with it. I also like the no lag optical connection--a big step up from the BluTooth speakers I had before. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Howatt

customer_reviews.title: I must say, These speakers are AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a few days looking at new computer speakers. I was looking at these and the Bose. I went into Best Buy and listened to these and they sounded awesome. The sound in the store is going to be different being in a large space, I got them and hooked them up to my computer and was pretty amazed. They sound super crisp and they can produce some great Bass. Its nice Logitech included a Bass control knob on the right speaker along with a volume knob. They were packed very well and came super quick. Im very happy with these and love the sound. I highly recommend these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Steven & Heather

customer_reviews.title: More bad than good - don't know where all the great reviews came from
customer_reviews.text: This is a very treble forward sounding system and the treble is ok but a little harsh. It would be mellowed if there were more bass and and mid range. But the bass, turned all the way up, is weak overall. With the bass knob at the midpoint, there's almost no bass. I sort of got swept away from all the great reviews. But I'm not hearing it. I may compare to my Bose Companion 20 (on a different computer) which tends to give a good balance without a subwoofer. Granted it is more money, but I will never be satisfied with this system. Glad I kept the box and wrapping......it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: cincinnatislim

customer_reviews.title: Great setup with Booming Bass
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker set based largely on the reviews for it. I couldn't afford an expensive set of studio monitors for my keyboard so I got this and boy am I happy. They are plenty loud for my living room in my apartment and the sound quality is awesome. The Bass is BOOMING at 50% and I guarantee that my neighbor 2 floors up can hear it. All components are very well made and solid. The sound is true to the keyboard, no distortion at all. Now I don't believe they are as loud as a 400 watt system should be, but it's still loud enough for most applications other than performing at a gig. A+++++++++++ LOGITECH
customer_reviews.author: Paul J Hess

customer_reviews.title: Sub-woofer stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I cant recommend this product since the subwoofer has stopped working after only 6 months. I currently am trying to submit a warranty claim on the product and will update the review once that has been completed. Disappointed that I even have to do this on a 6 month old speaker system.
customer_reviews.author: C. Courtney

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: Our family computer has been overdue a good set of speakers. I actually have been using an older set of Altec Lansings that came with our Windows 95 computer!! All I can say is WOW!! The sound is amazing, and the bass is loud and tight!! The speakers also have solid (not cheap) anti-slip rubber underneath them, which is great. I took one star off because of the short wiring, and the VGA connector set up for the right speaker. Weird design - why not just make both speakers connect using RCA jacks? Overall, you won't be disappointed in sound. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: lOcO

customer_reviews.title: Nice and clear with a thump.
customer_reviews.text: I like a good pair of desk top speakers like this. They sound excellent. They're real solid which surprised me. Good quality speakers. And the base is a nice hard hitter as well. In the end they are still desk top speakers. But I truly believe that I got my moneys worth here. And I'm sure you will to. I recommend these to anybody that want's decent sound, especially for a good gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: Issac E. Howard Jr.

customer_reviews.title: ALL THE BASS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: As the title states, this speaker system is capable of giving you ALL the bass if you want it. And its smooth, no distortion, no over exertion on the sub. The mids are rich and clear. The highs come through well but could be a little more crisp. I perhaps could find some EQ settings in my computer and bring the highs up some, that's for another day. but for this price..... Seriously amazing speakers, honestly.... Edit** with some EQ tweaking the highs are coming through more clearly and this system has a very nice balanced sound. Genuinely good speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Speaker Headphone Jack Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is fine, and what I expected. The reason for the 2 stars is that the headphone jack on the right speaker doesn't function properly, in short, I am required to move the jack about until it finally works. I purchased the system in Dec 2017, and only got in installed last week do to work, and I discovered today that support ended in February, so 3 months? That's crazy. I have never heard of support being less than a year? I was hesitant to buy from Logitech since their products are often wonky, and here we go again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Music sounds amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Using these in my home office on my desktop. Subwoofer is in the kneehole of the desk. Ears about 2.5 feet from L/R uppers. I used to be a bit of an audio snob. First thing I played was "Flim and the BB's" cd called "Tricycle". Was totally shocked and delighted at how clean and deep of a THUMP I got when the drummer kicked his foot. The high-end treble was equally as impressive. Would have paid twice what I did for these had I demo-ed them in a store. Worth every single penny!
customer_reviews.author: Zimmer Graphics Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Fantastic speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery and excellent packaging to protect these speakers. We have smaller logitech speakers (z313) and liked them so much that we decided to get these to really improve the quality of our entertainment. So now we have the small ones connected to one echo dot and TV in master bedroom, and these powerful speakers hooked up to another echo dot and TV in our living room! Easy setup! Sound is amazing for speakers especially at such a reasonable price point! Wow! Love these! You have to hear them to believe the quality! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pops and distortion, even on low volume
customer_reviews.text: First thing I noticed was a really high mid-range and not so good treble. Vocals sounded like in a tunnel. I figured I could just use an equalizer and that helped, but then the bass started popping, even when music was off. It would just do a loud 'pop' out of nowhere. Since I had this thing connected to a surge protection battery, it was not the power. Then there was the distortion, which I noticed on the right side speaker. At that point, I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmic-Surf

customer_reviews.title: beautiful sound
customer_reviews.text: The clarity out of these speakers is top notch. I've historically had Klipsch 2.1s and were very happy with them. I decided to try another brand to check out what other companies are doing. The ports, the user interface toggles on the speakers, the connections, everything is great about these speakers. Can't find a single fault.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Dingman

customer_reviews.title: Best Overall Desk Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I teach music lessons and need a loud clear set of desktop speakers to be heard above a trumpet player. After looking and testing I purchased these. They get used quite a bit and unfortunately they only lasted about 4 years. When the first set played out, I tried another brand and they just couldn't cut it...too soft to compete with the trumpet. So, I purchased another set of the Logitech and they have been working great ever since. It's been about 9 months so we'll see how long this set lasts. Still the best speaker for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Houston Trumpets

customer_reviews.title: Full sound, good base for the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a Z500 series several (10+) years ago so was familiar with the 5.1 output. Wanted to purchase Z906. Economically decided on the Z623. As a sound enthusiast, I am impressed with the output for the money spent. Originally purchased to enhance my gaming experience, I'm currently scrolling through my iTunes playlist - Hip Hop, R&B, Rock, some Alternative. It all sounds good. Highs and midrange sound great. Bass doesn't peel my hair back, but for a home office setting, this is MORE than enough rich sound to pass the hours. Just received my order today and haven't stopped listening since setting up a few hours ago. Would absolutely recommend this product. Second time Logitech customer and they didn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ford

customer_reviews.title: Not 400 or 200 Watts maybe 50 Watts.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I was expecting so much more according to all the reviews. These aren't much better than my twenty-year-old Logitech speakers. I can guarantee you this is not 400 watts and is not 200 Watts. I'd be willing to bet good money that they are about 50 Watts. They are loud and they are clear but they are not 200 Watts. These speakers won't go above 90 decibels with everything I've tried. I was hoping for louder but I got a peak of about 90 with most music around 75 to 80 decibels. I would not recommend unless you were giving them to your children or just want a little bit louder sound from your TV.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: LOUD
customer_reviews.text: Logitech, plenty of Bass, High-End, but lacks Mid-Range. Better than Monitor Speakers, excellent for PC Gamers, LOUD. I'm not much of a 'Gamer', but good enough for Music in my opinion if you're not an 'audiophile'. The 'cord' is thick and may cause anxiety for OCD 'Cable-Management' users', still should 'NOT' be a deal-breaker. Excellent 'price-point'. I'd re-purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, solid bass, excellent all around!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure about spending this much on a 2.1 setup for my PC but rolled the dice due to all the positive reviews and my general run of good luck with Logitech, and I can say that this speaker set far exceeded my every expectation. As good as it looks (and it really does, the speakers and sub are rock solid and don't draw attention away from the monitor) the sound quality is absolutely brilliant. The highs are crisp, the bass kicks without muddying the lows, and the separation is fantastic. This setup truly earns its THX branding and I am very happy to have given it a chance.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Not an audiophile by any means nor do I track it monitor sound with other gadgets, but these speakers sound great and are a huge upgrade from my cheaper Logitech speakers that died after many years. These sound great across movies and music. Cables are just long enough for my setup, but could see the need for extensions or longer cables for others. Volume and bass control right on the speaker is a great feature. Like that it has a couple options for hooking up devices to them. Overall great speakers, glad I splurged some, and would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R

customer_reviews.title: A decent system at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a good little sound system. The sound quality is decent and loud - well above the price point, but the bass is kinda hard to dial in - any more than halfway and it overpowers whatever you're listening to, so having to keep getting up to adjust it is a bit of a drag, but once you dial it in it's less of an issue. The proprietory cable connecting the right satellite speaker to the sub is an inconvenient, unnecessary and unwelcome design - I had to buy a separate special cable to lengthen its reach for my setup.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bear

customer_reviews.title: These speakers have great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace an Altec Lansing set of computer speakers which finally gave out after 15 years or so. These speakers have great sound quality, and certainly live up to many of the reviews. Only reason I give them a three star, is the listing shows them as 200 watts, the box says 400 watts which if I had to guess is an extreme peak rating. Having been an audiophile for many years with experience with numerous sound systems, I can say without doubt I find it very hard to believe these speakers are 200 watts. Otherwise, it is a great sound system for the price.
customer_reviews.author: cdmanoise

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Sadly the Bose Companion 3 finally kicked the bucket. I wanted speakers with a subwoofer and decided on the Logitech Z623. I was prepared to note a discernible sound difference from going from a Bose product however, I was pleasantly surprised. The highs are crisp and not distorted. The bass can shake the paint from the drywall. Overall I am impressed with the quality of the sound. No it's not a Bose, but it's pretty close, especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Rockin my home office!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set-up as an upgrade for mostly music enjoyment from my laptop in my home office. i previously had purchased these (  ) and really enjoyed them.. But they couldn't do justice to the need to really kick "Come Sail Away" and my other 70's rock favs when the mood struck me to just get deaf from time to time. These speakers kick ass!! Beautiful, room filling, high volume, highly clarified sound emanates from them even with the basic sound card my laptop has installed in it (No variable EQ or anything like that whatsoever.) Ordering another set for my tv in the living room very soon!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: Double Purchase?!
customer_reviews.text: I will make this review, short, simple, and to the point. This Logitech system is SO good, I bought a second system and dual paired it to the first system. Outstanding quality and sound, especially for the general price. The only thing to be aware is dependent on type of input, this system may require a stereo line amplifier to get maximum performance.
customer_reviews.author: xTheBlackKnighx

customer_reviews.title: High Quality & Super Loud!
customer_reviews.text: I looked around pretty extensively for an affordable pair of computer speakers capable of getting super loud without distortion. These are definitely exactly what I was looking for! At full volume, they are nearly too loud for even me -- and I am partially deaf and still like my music LOUD. I don't know how to estimate the decibel level, but it is on par with a loud rock concert. I am sure there are better speakers for a lot more money, but for normal people that just like loud music -- these are great!
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: The Bass is Window-Rattling Quality
customer_reviews.text: The sound coming from these babies is amazing. But my favorite part of them is the bass. You can turn it all the way down if it's not for you, but I've only turned it 3/4 of the way up and it absolutely shakes my very soul. I love these. Buy them, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple other speaker systems for my computer. They were never able to be loud at all, very quiet. But these i never have to go above half volume. And they sound great. I have the bass on the floor, so when seated as my desk it is not very noticeable. Most of the sound seems to come from the two top speakers. However, I can hear the bass when in direct line of sight from the subwoofer. Might be my settings, who knows. But I am glad to have these.
customer_reviews.author: RSmerlinious0

customer_reviews.title: Really nice sound!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my Creative 5.1 surround system, which died right after the 1-year warranty ran out, and I have been pleasantly surprised by the sound quality of these Logitech speakers. Not having that tangle of wires from a 5.1 system is also very nice. I do miss the surround sound, but only my Blu-ray discs have that. Most of what I watch and listen to is in stereo, and these really deliver quality playback, so I am very happy with them. In addition, I no longer have to worry when Windows 10 updates my Realtek driver, and that is another plus. It didn't work well for the 5.1 system, but works well with these.
customer_reviews.author: Celestial Lady

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Omg these speakers are just amazing. They shake the whole house! It's the cleanest bass and sfx I have ever heard in a system for this price. I can't recommend these enough! They are fantastic for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Clover

customer_reviews.title: Bown away both by the sound quality and my ear drums!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was probably my best purchase off Amazon this year. Didn't expect a set of speakers to make such an impression on me and for about $120 it sounded better than some of speakers I got that were twice the price. The sound is so crisp and ripen with so much fidelity and no noticeable distortions. For this price range, I doubt you'll find anything remotely close to the sound quality you get from these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: 코나

customer_reviews.title: Crisp Clean Sound & Deep Bass
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hook up to my new VIZIO TV. The sound on the TV was kind of muddled. Hooked this up and the sound is crystal clear with deep bass. Even at regular volume the bass comes through. It's like night and day. I'm using the Optical Cord. I don't know how much of a difference it makes but the sound is perfect. My only complaint is not being able to use the remote for volume control or mute but I knew that going in. Overall I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy These Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade my speaker system, and read lots of reviews on different systems. Based on reviews, and personal research, I decided to go with these Logitechs. WOW. Easily, the best speakers I've ever used for a computer. They just sound absolutely amazing. I'm not an audiophile, and I won't even try to get into technical details about why these are great speakers. I'll just tell you that I know what sounds good, and these are just amazing. BUY WITH CONFIDENCE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DayTripper

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for The Buck
customer_reviews.text: For The Price these are by far the best quality speakers available if you play music off your computer. The Bass will literally overpower everything if you dont adjust it, but the sound is clear and distortion free up to any reasonable volume you may use. I can turn it up downstairs and hear it clearly upstairs. when using the computer you have to turn the bass almost off or you will get all kinds of wierd computer sounds you normally wouldn't pay attention to. You can control the main volume and also adjust the bass sensitivity. overall to get better sound you will pay far more than $119
customer_reviews.author: James A. Cummons

customer_reviews.title: Great THX sound, Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these speakers. It puts out 400 watts of THX certified sound, and it lives up do it in every way. Strong bass that doesn't rattle or distort. Nice clean treble. I can also use the on my brand new Samsung QLED 55inch TV. So whether I'm gaming on my PS4pro, High end gaming PC, or simply watching TV. These speakers are everything I wanted and more. I don't need a sound bar for my TV now as well. TLDR: These are simply well worth it for PC's or TV's whether you're gaming or watching shows/movies.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Blown away
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 8 year old son’s chrome book. BIG MISTAKE! These things are so loud and clear I shouldn’t have bought them for myself! :). Blown away with the sound and clarity. They about rattle pictures off our wall in our living room. I told him no louder than halfway and to keep the base control set to halfway as I tried not to laugh as my wife was giving me the stink eye for purchasing this set. I think I’ll be ordering myself a pair of these :-).
customer_reviews.author: R. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Boy oh boy, do I like these speakers. I have had my own recording studios, with all kinds of speakers, amps, etc. For a set of computer speakers, these are awesome. I really do like them. I gave it a 5-Star for over all, and it deserves it. Maybe just a little weak on some bass feeds, but still within my comfort zone of acceptability. Well worth every penny. You won't be disappointed. I may buy another set for my other computer, they're that good.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Thanks so much for such great speakers Logitech
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my classroom. I've been an avid gamer and running everything on computers, projectors, home entertainment systems... blah blah blah... These things blew every pair of computer speakers I have ever bought away. I of course wanted to test them out, so maxed out the base and turned them up to maybe 60%. That might have been a mistake. They blew me right out of my chair which hurt my hip; my socks - they flew off my feet, opened the office door by themselves, and ran down the hallway. They have not returned! Thanks so much for such great speakers Logitech. I'll probably buy another set to use at home too. Phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The power that just 2 .1 speaker system can create blows my mind
customer_reviews.text: I am not technical savy about speakers but I do know that this Logitech 2.1 speaker system connected to my computer, make my games and music rock . Speaker #1 has a bit of a short cord but I worked with the discrepancy . Speakers are nice looking and durable. Has a on / off button that you push, volume control dial and Bass control dial . What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: B. Owen

customer_reviews.title: 15 seconds of greatness...and that was it!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers arrived inside only a cardboard shipping box with zero factory packaging or user manual. One corner on the subwoofer was cracked (I’m assuming this happened during shipping since there was minimal bubble wrapping and no protective factory packaging). After set up I got to mix approximately half a song before one speaker stopped working almost entirely. Occasionally it would jolt back on only to go back out again immediately. I triple checked all the connections and they looked secure but I could not get the speaker to work consistently. For the 15 seconds everything was working it sounded great, but sadly I had to return and have these speakers refunded. Super bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Pudewa

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges and corners on subwoofer make it dangerous, weak high end
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok speaker set, good if you just want driving bass, but not much for the highs and mids. The satellitesn seem to be small woofers and there is just a simulation tweeter port with no tweeter, so it lacks high range, I would recommend the Klipsch THX computer speakers or the Amazon Echo Studio if you want a smart speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon K. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Best gift to buy your Dad
customer_reviews.text: My dad loved this. He had some old PC speakers and it was just time for an upgrade. Sub woofer is on point; perfect for jazz especially in the holiday season. Awesome sound quality. Sounds a lot nicer then studio monitors since I'm not trying to pinpoint sound accuracy and am looking for that badaboom sound quality; I point that out because a lot of non musicians really get those two confused while in contrast these are freaking solid quality and for only $100. My dad absolutely loves these.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality !
customer_reviews.text: This is the best computer speaker set you can buy for the money, the only one close is the Klipsch set and it cost about thirty dollars more. The highs are really good and the bass is as good, one of the best qualities of this set is when you increase the volume is doesn't fall off the more you increase , it keeps on going ! If you are shopping for speakers in this category, these will work well for you. I know a little bit about sound quality and this set sounds really good !
customer_reviews.author: Kenno25

customer_reviews.title: Defective design?
customer_reviews.text: I noticed after a few weeks that if you leave the power on but no music is playing, there is a low "wubwubwubwub" kind of sound coming from the subwoofer. Sounds like a helicopter off in the distance, but ALL the time. It happens even when completely disconnected from the computer and even plugged into power at a different location. So I contacted Logitech, and they replaced it under warranty. They shipped a new set out, easy as pie. Awesome! Except a week later, the new speakers started doing the same thing. Avoid these speakers unless you don't mind turning the power off every time there's no sound coming from them.
customer_reviews.author: Nose

customer_reviews.title: These sound great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm blown away by how good these sound for the price. The bass is almost too much but the speaker pod has a knob to control it. I have one minor issue with them, the speaker pod design . They are oddly shaped, they don't have wall mounting holes and the drivers are angled slightly upward. This is great if you want to donate a lot of desk space to them but it makes it nearly impossible to get them off the desk. For this price point I am blown away! I expected to spend two to three times what these cost for this level of sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Zareek

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful rich bass
customer_reviews.text: Holy sh*t! I upgraded from the 313's and sweet baby jesus these speakers are so much better. (They were decent btw) Couple things to keep in mind: the cables for the satellite speakers (L&R) are kinda short (4-5 feet?), the cable for the right speaker is pretty heavy duty because it uses a serial connection since thats where all the controls and jacks for headphones and aux are. Also if you share a wall, floor, or ceiling with a neighbor... I hope they like bass haha. It pounds. Luckily there is a nicely responsive bass control on the right speaker. Otherwise pretty lightweight and sleek looking. Definitely recomend these!
customer_reviews.author: WhimSicKill

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound for two years, then the right speaker started having issues
customer_reviews.text: I've pretty much always liked logitech products for sound. They've pretty consistently done fantastic things for very reasonable prices, but the last three speaker sets I've bought from them (5.1, 5.1, and this 2.1), have all died after two years. Very little movement of them, no mishandling, etc. The 5.1s just flat out died, but the 2.1 did the weird sound thing I'm seeing in other reviews. It had a high-pitched tone, and sounded "tinny," like it had been an old worn out speaker from the 90s. Those two years were great! Just wish I was getting a bit longer of a shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Using it for my computer for sound
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this and so far it has been a great speaker system for gaming on my computer. I did need extension cables for both speakers and was able to extend both by buying after market cables. Works great and sounds great. Left speaker extension cable was  and the right speaker I used
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Best for gaming & movies. Music needs EQ'd.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality for gaming and movies is amazing, but if you're solely looking at these primarily for music I'd suggest looking elsewhere. With that said you can equalize the sound so it doesn't sound so flat and dull. After tweaking through windows media and vlc, I'm content. Overall the sound quality is night and day over my $50-80 pc speakers. Though if I didn't already have a gaming PC I probably would've returned for a better music experience.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Item.  Great Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Revised review 3.8.19: I bought these due to reviews. I replaced my Logitech speakers (older model) which were replacing that same, older model. Either the left or right speaker always went out. I have had these for 2 years now and they are great. I use them as speakers for my projection system to watch dvds, tv, and play Nintendo. Great, booming sound. Really need to adjust sound strength, but I am sure I'd blow out my windows if I cranked them up all the way. They look nice and seem really sturdy, at least compared to my old Logitechs.
customer_reviews.author: KinoChelovek

customer_reviews.title: ok but not for audiophiles
customer_reviews.text: Pluses: good adjustable bass, and don't take up much space. Minuses: 1) these speakers sound rather tin-ny: because they don't have both a woofer and a tweeter in the sattelites you don't get the decent mid and high range you would from the Kilpsch 2.1 Thx speakers, 2) most of the power goes to the subwoofer, so the overall volume doesn't get that high since the sattelites are underpowered. So while they are unsuitable for people who are serious about listening to music, they would be a fine present for a kid who wants to use them for gaming and wants to hear loud explosions, especially if you get them on sale for $90 as we did.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Get them your going to love em!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok these bad boys are amazing! I mean for real for a 100 bucks you cant beat these at all there so nice. I mean they are made strong they dont feel like other pc speakers. when you pick them up it doesn't feel like your going to crunch them in your hands. They are strong and stable to say the least. They look amazing on my desk one on either side of my ultrawide monitor. And the sub is 100% legit yoo. Bass is soooooo good on this little thing sounds like the 10in sub on 850watts in my truck. And the bass knob on the desk speaker to adjust it is convenient as hell for late night gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Vapin clowds

customer_reviews.title: High quality at low cost.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this system to replace a previous Logitech system that wore out after 10 years of daily use. This new Logitech system is far superior than the old one. I'm getting tone and voicing now that the old system never had even when new. I am using this set of speakers with several others in a virtual theater pipe organ. I can't believe how rich the sound is with this new Logitech setup. The price is low, the quality of these is high in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Good 2.1 Speaker System from Logitech
customer_reviews.text: I've had Different 2.1 speaker systems over the years from both Logitech and other Name-brand Speaker System makers and By far this is the best sounding of them by far. The sound is crisp and the Bass Hits Hard. I keep mine in the middle of the Vol and Bass Knobs and it Sounds great. Dose not get distortions at Hi Volumes . Overall This Is worth the Money if you Don't have a mint to spend on good Gaming Speakers.
customer_reviews.author: JamesB813

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I just connected this speaker system to my PC and I am more than happy with the sound/function. The price was great for the quality of sound and bass you get. The bass unit is pretty hefty and does a great job pushing plenty of low sound. I only have the bass knob to 1/2 and you can hear it outside, with all windows and doors closed (sorry neighbors, just testing the new speakers). Get this set, you will be happy with the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Grable

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product / Great Price Updated To Show 2nd Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Loaded with power. These things are clear and if you're not a rigid audiophile they sound really good. They don't lose clarity when you turn them up. I've had some that were better but I am very pleased with this speaker system for my PC. My wife loved how nice these are when I play music from my PC. She liked them so much that I bought her a set for Christmas. You know they're good when your other system is a Bose and you listen to these more.
customer_reviews.author: M. R.

customer_reviews.title: NOT impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Everything works... Superb pounding base. Sound quality good. My biggest complaint? The mid range and treble volume. For lack of any audiophile vocabulary --------------------IT SUCKS! The crappy little antique 20 year old speakers I replaced with this had far louder volume. Even with these cranked full volume they just don't fill my closet size office! VERY DISAPPOINTED. Never Logitech again.
customer_reviews.author: Marc W

customer_reviews.title: Terrible highs, though great bass
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the subwoofer is excellent, but the satellites pump out very disappointing highs. I listen to a lot of orchestral music with flutes, harps, etc., and the "tinny" sound is very distracting. I'm not a serious audiophile, so if I can hear it, it will drive more serious people mad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: They don't fill a room, but they will fill your ears!
customer_reviews.text: These things will fill your the center of your head, as stereo was designed to do. All that is needed will be to move your head to position the sound equally, and LOUD!. I love they spatial surround like the band's speakers are duct taped to your skull. For me (rock and roll is meant to be played so loud your poor ears are being damaged) without distortion. I truly LOVE how they reach behind my ears encompassing the surround with on 2 spacers and a bass.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Goodhue

customer_reviews.title: Great midrange $$$ solution
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a better speaker system for my desktop setup and these fit the bill without spending a mint on Bose or some of the other high end sets. These are not the cheap speakers you buy at Walmart. Very nice (heavy and well made) sub and the two satellite speakers are clear and crisp all they way to the top of the volume scale! I did equalize my computers sound with a free software download from APO and they sound even better. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Geddings

customer_reviews.title: Logitech still one  the best for the buget
customer_reviews.text: My old Logitech die out after years of good use.So I upgraded to a higher end model.Not surprise in the sound quality of Logitech Z623 400 Watt Home Speaker System, 2.1 Speaker System. Been a fan of this brand name for a long time.And it's sound quality never sounded better specially with this sub woofer. And good midrange.Just plug 3.5 plug which comes with this unit and you ready for some good sound. Money well spent for the budget.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Pretlow

customer_reviews.title: Not cool stopped working after four months
customer_reviews.text: Honestly better than I expected 👌 it has nice crsip sound and big bass. I'm absolutely loving it. Happy with it. The only thing is it was shipped in the natural box it comes in. Not in a Amazon box. Thankfully the person who delivered it covered it up with my front door mat. UPDATE: stopped working after 4 months soon disappointed i spent so much money for this. Cant trust amazon for electronics
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Very good computer speakers
customer_reviews.text: This is a good computer desk speaker set. The cheaper Logitech Z513 speakers have enough power, but they underperform with the mids. These more expensive Z623 don't have problem with the mids.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Roberge

customer_reviews.title: Incredible while they lasted. 2 yrs.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible for the last two years and four months. Today, the right speaker died. That's the shortest life I've ever gotten out of a set of speakers. However, during those two years and four months, they were incredible. I'll have to check and see if they're worth buying again or if there's another brand out there. I had a set of the Klipsch ProMedia 2.1 THX before these, and they lasted MUCH longer before finally giving out. Now that they're only about fifty dollars more than these, I might get them again instead.
customer_reviews.author: General Tso Tofu

customer_reviews.title: Lot of sound for such a small set
customer_reviews.text: You must disable dolby digital and dts encoding. Even though this supports optical input, it does not support dolby or dts decoding. You must disable them in your sound settings. Otherwise you'll get a beeping sound out of the speakers telling you it can't decode the signal.
customer_reviews.author: SW Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've been thinking of replacing the $20 computer speakers I bought back in the 1990's for a while now. After plenty of research, I decided on these over many other brands mostly because of the positive reviews. The sound quality is amazing and I literally can't turn them up to full volume because of how loud these speakers are. The bass from the subwoofer is literally bone-rattling. I would suggest these to anyone looking for a great set of speakers for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben R.

customer_reviews.title: Quality is great!
customer_reviews.text: Great 2.1 desktop speakers! Not much midrange but the great sub and tweeters make up for it and even out the sound. Prefer these high quality clean sounding tweeters over muddy midrange amyway. Only thing lacking is a higher quality 3.5 audio cable.
customer_reviews.author: ZIPPY

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker system for desk setup
customer_reviews.text: Got these speakers during the black friday sale. On initial impressions, these speakers can get loud and the bass can get thumping. Everything is easy to plug in and left and right channels have different connectors so you can't put the stereo speakers in wrong. Overall recommend to get these for a easy plug and play system.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Like that really nice girl who looks like Shrek
customer_reviews.text: They sound pretty bad out of the box. The bass is way too much and the mids aren't there at all. After some adjustments with the EQ though, they sound good. I plan on returning these though because they are just so ugly. The satellite speakers specifically look hideous and cheap. I just can't stand looking at them. The shape, the knobs, those four screws, the cage on the front, it's all terrible. I don't understand why Logitech doesn't give them a design update as all their other desktop speakers look much better. It is a shame as the price is very good for what you get. Would definitely keep these if they looked better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I am an audiophile by nature used to Paradigm speakers driven by Marantz pushed to the upper limits and for easy listening. For $100 fed by optical connection without a soundcard powered only by my ASUS Rog Strix Z390 E motherboard I literally rate it a 7 against an $8000 audio system. This system rocks and bass is thumping. Or it is crisp and clean at lower levels. I just bought it because it was the only 200 watt 2.1 system out there. Maybe my ears are losing some highs and mids from past audio abuse but this is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Groff

customer_reviews.title: very impressive sound
customer_reviews.text: the logitech z623 delivers very impressive sound. the sound is very immersive and has extremely deep bass. even at low volumes the sound is quite deep and full bodied. the unit really is impressive when turned up loud. you can actually feel the air moving, the floor and walls and walls seem to shake. it's not the rumbling sound you get from lower cost speakers, it's the real thing. extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Nails

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace 13 year old speakers that were damaged in my last move. These were refurbished units but looked brand new when I opened the package. They sound great too. Previous computer setup was 4 satellites and a sub woofer with 70 watts RMS, they sounded great too, but one was damaged. These sound much better, with deeper bass, and a volume level so loud I doubt I will ever reach it. Have not tried watching a movie yet with them, but for gaming, and music they are well worth the price. I would definitely buy another set should I need more speakers in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Thomas

product_meta.title: Logitech Z623 400 Watt Home Speaker System, 2.1 Speaker System - Black
product_meta.description:
Style:AnalogLogitech Speaker system Z623 with THX-certified 2.1 system delivers big, bold sound with 200 watts (RMS) of power-from your music, movies, and games.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER










COMPATIBILITY




COMPARE


Which Logitech Speakers Are Right For You?
feature_bullets: THX-certified 2.1 speaker system brings your music, movies and games to life in immersive studio-quality audio; Satellites: 2 x 35 Watt
RCA and 3.5 millimeter inputs make it easy to plug in up to 3 audio devices - your computer, iPod, game console, DVD player and more
2 satellite speakers and a powerful subwoofer deliver sound big enough to fill even large entertainment rooms.Please Note: Kindly refer the User Guide before use.

Compatible with Television,Computer,Smartphone,Tablet,Music player,DVD player,Blu-ray player,PlayStation,Xbox,Wii. System Requirements: Works with any device with either a headphone jack (3.5 millimeter) or RCA input.

400 Watts Peak/200 Watts RMS power delivers amped audio from this 2.1 speaker system. Subwoofer-130 W. Dimensions( H x W x D)-Subwoofer-11.2 x 12.0 x 10.5 inches. Right Satellite-7.7 x 4.6 x 5.0 inches. Left Satellite-7.7 x 4.6 x 5.0 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars9,061 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
